item.title: Jacqueline add a quote by Madeleine L'Engle
item.description: "A book, too, can be a star, a living fire to lighten the darkness, leading out into the expanding universe." -- Madeleine L'Engle

item.title: Jacqueline add a quote by Immanuel Kant
item.description: "Look closely. The beautiful may be small." -- Immanuel Kant

item.title: Jacqueline add a quote by Frank Herbert
item.description: "Seek freedom and become captive of your desires. Seek discipline and find your liberty." -- Frank Herbert

item.title: Jacqueline add a quote by William S. Burroughs
item.description: "If I had my way we'd sleep every night all wrapped around each other like hibernating rattlesnakes." -- William S. Burroughs

item.title: Jacqueline add a quote by Aldous Huxley
item.description: "But I don't want comfort. I want God, I want poetry, I want real danger, I want freedom, I want goodness. I want sin." -- Aldous Huxley

item.title: Jacqueline add a quote by Ezra Pound
item.description: "Man reading should be man intensely alive. The book should be a ball of light in one's hand." -- Ezra Pound

item.title: Jacqueline add a quote by John Waters
item.description: "We need to make books cool again. If you go home with somebody and they don't have books, don't fuck them." -- John Waters

item.title: Jacqueline add a quote by D.H. Lawrence
item.description: "Yes, I do believe in something. I believe in being warm-hearted. I believe especially in being warm-hearted in love, in fucking with a warm heart. I believe if men could fuck with warm hearts, and the women take it warm-heartedly, everything would come all right. It's all this cold-hearted fucking that is death and idiocy." -- D.H. Lawrence

item.title: Jacqueline add a quote by Henry David Thoreau
item.description: "Pursue some path, however narrow and crooked, in which you can walk with love and reverence." -- Henry David Thoreau

item.title: Jacqueline add a quote by Robert A. Heinlein
item.description: "There is no such thing as "Just a cat." -- Robert A. Heinlein

item.title: Jacqueline add a quote by D.H. Lawrence
item.description: "For my part, I prefer my heart to be broken. It is so lovely, dawn-kaleidoscopic within the crack." -- D.H. Lawrence

item.title: Jacqueline add a quote by Arthur C. Clarke
item.description: "Before you become too entranced with gorgeous gadgets and mesmerizing video displays, let me remind you that information is not knowledge, knowledge is not wisdom, and wisdom is not foresight. Each grows out of the other, and we need them all." -- Arthur C. Clarke

item.title: Jacqueline add a quote by Arthur C. Clarke
item.description: "I don’t believe in astrology; I’m a Sagittarius and we’re skeptical." -- Arthur C. Clarke

item.title: Jacqueline add a quote by Charlie Kaufman
item.description: "There are too many ideas and things and people. Too many directions to go. I was starting to believe the reason it matters to care passionately about something, is that it whittles the world down to a more manageable size." -- Charlie Kaufman

item.title: Jacqueline add a quote by David Mitchell
item.description: "A half-read book is a half-finished love affair." -- David Mitchell

item.title: Jacqueline add a quote by William Blake
item.description: "If the doors of perception were cleansed every thing would appear to man as it is, Infinite. For man has closed himself up, till he sees all things thro' narrow chinks of his cavern." -- William Blake

item.title: Jacqueline add a quote by Friedrich Nietzsche
item.description: "In heaven, all the interesting people are missing." -- Friedrich Nietzsche
